Dispute_Type: Discovery dispute in patent infringement case
Legal_Issue: Relevance of discovery questions under procedural rules
Evidence_Assessment: Questions related to unadmitted allegations or persons with relevant knowledge
Decision_Outcome: Most decisions upheld; two hypothetical questions and one category ordered for answers
Burden_of_Proof: On party objecting to discovery questions to show irrelevance or impropriety
Legal_Rule: Rule 458(1): Questions must relate to unadmitted facts or identifying relevant witnesses
Standard_of_Review: Deferential unless clearly wrong or vital to final issues
Procedural_Issue: Scope and relevance of discovery questions
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged patent infringement involving paper plates
Outcome_on_Merits: Partial allowance of appeal; some questions required to be answered
Review_Standard: Clearly wrong or vital to final issues
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Ensuring fair discovery process under court rules
Key_Evidence_Considered: Categories of discovery questions on inducement, commercial success, hypotheticals
Legal_Framework: Federal Court Rules and Aqua-Gem standards
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging refusal to answer certain discovery questions
Court_Result: Some questions reclassified as requiring answers
Defendant_Response: Objections to certain discovery questions as speculative or irrelevant
Remedy_Requested: Order compelling answers to discovery questions
Outcome: Partial grant of remedy; answers required for specific questions and category
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for order compelling discovery responses
